development_goal: Introduce baby to light, sound, and touch; build sensory awareness.
skill: Focus briefly on faces and light sources
activity_idea: Hold baby close to your face under soft light and let them gaze at your eyes for a few seconds.

development_goal: Develop early visual focus and awareness.
skill: Responds to high-contrast black-and-white visuals
activity_idea: Show black-and-white cards 8–10 inches away for a few seconds while talking softly.

development_goal: Strengthen visual tracking and contrast recognition.
skill: Turns head toward bright light or movement
activity_idea: Slowly move a contrasting object side-to-side in front of baby’s eyes for them to follow.

skill: Recognizes caregiver’s voice and tone
activity_idea: Speak gently near baby’s ear and pause—notice if baby quiets or turns head toward sound.

development_goal: Encourage auditory response to soft sounds.
skill: Turns head toward gentle sounds
activity_idea: Use a soft rattle near baby’s head, alternating sides slowly, allowing time to respond.

skill: Begins to recognize caregiver’s scent
activity_idea: Place a soft cloth worn by the parent near the baby during sleep or feeding for familiarity.

skill: Explores touch through skin contact
activity_idea: Let baby feel your hand or cheek during feeding or cuddling time.

development_goal: Strengthen sense of balance and orientation.
skill: Responds to gentle movement and rocking
activity_idea: Hold baby securely and sway gently to soft music or humming.

skill: Stays calm during low background noise
activity_idea: Keep baby in the room with mild household sounds (fan, low music) to build awareness.

skill: Responds positively to skin-to-skin contact
activity_idea: Hold baby against bare chest after feeding or during naps for warmth and comfort.

skill: Notices changes in texture (soft, rough)
activity_idea: Gently let baby touch a soft cloth and a smooth silk scarf during play.

skill: Turns head toward caregiver’s humming
activity_idea: Hum softly on one side of baby’s ear and observe head turning or quieting response.

skill: Gazes at slow-moving light reflection
activity_idea: Reflect light softly on the wall using a small mirror or metallic mobile.

skill: Associates feeding with warmth and smell
activity_idea: Feed in calm lighting and consistent scent (parent’s natural smell).

skill: Responds differently to soft vs. loud sounds
activity_idea: Alternate between gentle humming and a soft bell, pausing for baby’s reaction.

skill: Blinks or squints at sudden light
activity_idea: Dim and brighten a nearby lamp gently during calm time.

development_goal: Introduce baby to light, sound, and touch; build sensory awareness.
skill: Briefly follows a close face side-to-side
activity_idea: Hold your face 8–12 inches from baby and move slowly side-to-side so they can track your eyes and mouth.

development_goal: Support safe startle reflex and calming strategies.
skill: Exhibits startle (Moro) reflex to sudden loud noises
activity_idea: Avoid abrupt loud sounds; if startled, soothe with gentle holding and a calm voice until baby relaxes.

development_goal: Reinforce familiarity through scent and touch.
skill: Calms more quickly to familiar caregiver scent and touch
activity_idea: Keep a soft cloth with parent's scent near baby at sleep or cuddle times to provide reassurance.

development_goal: Encourage response to rhythmic sound and routine.
skill: Responds to rhythmic lullaby or soft humming
activity_idea: Sing or hum a simple lullaby consistently at naptime to build association and calmness.

development_goal: Increase brief alertness to faces and expressions.
skill: Shows short periods of alert gaze toward human faces
activity_idea: Spend a few minutes of quiet face-to-face time after feeding, using gentle expressions and slow smiles.

development_goal: Introduce gentle temperature/pressure awareness for comfort.
skill: Responds to warm touch and gentle pressure
activity_idea: Warm your hands before holding and gently stroke arms or back to provide comforting tactile input.

development_goal: Develop early horizontal tracking of high-contrast objects.
skill: Can track a slowly moving high-contrast object horizontally
activity_idea: Move a black-and-white card slowly left to right about 8–12 inches from the baby’s face.

development_goal: Use caregiver voice to soothe and focus attention.
skill: May stop fussing or quiet when hearing caregiver’s voice
activity_idea: Speak or sing softly near baby when they are fussy and note calming or head-turning responses.

development_goal: Promote sensory consistency through repeated exposure.
skill: Begins to expect familiar daily sounds
activity_idea: Keep a consistent background sound such as soft music or a gentle fan during naps to support sensory familiarity.

development_goal: Build association between movement and sight.
skill: Visually follows rocking motion or moving mobile
activity_idea: Hang a simple high-contrast mobile and gently move it so baby can watch while lying on their back.

development_goal: Support orientation to vertical vs. horizontal positions.
skill: Shows awareness of positional changes
activity_idea: Hold baby upright briefly, then lay them back slowly to help them perceive different head positions safely.

development_goal: Encourage connection between sound and emotion.
skill: Responds differently to happy vs. soothing tones
activity_idea: Speak with varied emotions—smile while saying hello, then whisper soothingly to calm baby after feeding.

development_goal: Introduce soft light–dark transitions to develop visual adaptation.
skill: Adjusts eyes to gradual changes in lighting
activity_idea: Open curtains slowly in the morning to let baby experience light changes while in your arms.

development_goal: Encourage bilateral awareness through alternating stimuli.
skill: Turns head both left and right to sound
activity_idea: Alternate gentle rattling on each side of baby’s head, giving time to respond before switching sides.

development_goal: Support early awareness of gentle vibration.
skill: Notices mild vibration or rhythmic touch
activity_idea: Let baby rest hand or foot lightly on a softly humming item, like a baby-safe vibrating toy, for brief exposure.

development_goal: Promote calm sensory engagement through repetition.
skill: Shows comfort with repeated visual and sound cues
activity_idea: Repeat a short song and a slow hand movement together each day so baby starts to anticipate the rhythm.

skill: Makes spontaneous arm and leg movements
activity_idea: Lay baby on a soft blanket and let arms and legs move freely while observing.

skill: Grasps finger when placed in palm
activity_idea: Place your finger gently in baby’s palm and let them hold briefly, offering gentle praise.

skill: Turns head to one side when lying down
activity_idea: During tummy or back position, gently rotate baby’s head to notice natural reflexive movement.

development_goal: Promote leg kicking for muscle activation.
skill: Kicks legs spontaneously
activity_idea: Lay baby on back and gently move legs together, observing natural kicking motions.

skill: Moves arms reflexively
activity_idea: Observe baby lying on back; allow free arm movement without interference.

skill: Lifts head briefly during tummy time
activity_idea: Place baby on tummy for 1–2 minutes a few times a day with close supervision.

skill: Closes hand around objects
activity_idea: Offer a soft rattle for brief touch and observe reflexive grasping.

development_goal: Encourage coordinated leg and arm movement.
skill: Moves arms and legs together
activity_idea: During play on blanket, observe simultaneous limb movements without forcing position.

development_goal: Promote head turning with visual stimuli.
skill: Turns head toward moving object
activity_idea: Hold a high-contrast toy 8–12 inches away and move slowly to either side.

skill: Opens and closes fingers reflexively
activity_idea: Gently stroke palm or touch fingertips to encourage natural opening and closing.

skill: Lifts and stretches legs reflexively
activity_idea: Lay baby on back and gently move legs up and down while observing natural kicks.

skill: Brings hands toward face
activity_idea: Allow baby to explore by letting hands float near mouth and eyes during tummy or back time.

skill: Holds onto soft toy briefly
activity_idea: Place a soft cloth or toy in hand to observe natural gripping reflex.

skill: Raises head slightly during brief tummy positioning
activity_idea: Place baby on tummy for 30–60 seconds at a time under close supervision to encourage lifting head.

development_goal: Encourage kicking coordination with visual stimuli.
skill: Kicks legs in response to visual objects
activity_idea: Move a high-contrast toy above legs slowly to observe reflexive leg movement.

skill: Stretches arms upward reflexively
activity_idea: During calm alert periods, let baby’s arms naturally reach upward without interference.

skill: Turns slightly from back to side
activity_idea: Place baby on back and gently guide torso slightly to observe natural roll attempts.

skill: Touches and moves fingers over soft textures
activity_idea: Place soft fabrics near hands and observe natural tactile exploration.

skill: Bends and straightens legs reflexively
activity_idea: Lay baby on back and gently guide legs up and down to observe reflexive motion.

development_goal: Encourage coordinated movement with caregiver interaction.
skill: Moves arms in response to touch or voice
activity_idea: Gently stroke arms while speaking softly and observe reflexive movement coordination.

skill: Moves arms and legs rhythmically during alert periods
activity_idea: Place baby on a soft surface and let limbs move freely while talking or singing.

skill: Touches toys or objects placed nearby
activity_idea: Gently place a soft toy within reach and observe natural touching or batting reflex.

skill: Lifts head slightly while moving arms
activity_idea: During tummy time, allow baby to lift head while arms push gently against the floor.

skill: Kicks legs while lying on back
activity_idea: Observe spontaneous leg kicks and gently mimic rhythm with hands to engage.

development_goal: Support early grasp and release reflex.
skill: Opens and closes hands with reflexive movement
activity_idea: Place finger or soft object in hand and let baby grasp and release naturally.

development_goal: Promote coordination between limbs and gaze.
skill: Moves hands toward face while looking
activity_idea: Observe baby reaching hands toward mouth or eyes during calm alert state.

skill: Stretches arms and legs reflexively
activity_idea: During alert periods, observe natural stretching without interference.

skill: Pushes briefly against surface during tummy time
activity_idea: Place baby on tummy and observe natural attempts to push with arms and lift head.

skill: Brings hands together or to mouth
activity_idea: Observe baby touching hands together or exploring fingers with mouth during play.

skill: Moves arms and legs in response to caregiver
activity_idea: Gently touch or sway baby’s limbs while speaking softly and observe response.

skill: Swipes hands outward or upward reflexively
activity_idea: Observe baby’s spontaneous hand swipes during alert periods without interference.

skill: Lifts arms slightly when lying on back
activity_idea: Place baby on back and gently observe arm lifting as part of natural reflex.

skill: Bends and stretches legs alternately
activity_idea: Observe natural alternating leg movements while baby is on back during play.

skill: Reaches for high-contrast objects
activity_idea: Hold a black-and-white toy slightly above baby’s hands and observe attempts to reach.

skill: Curls arms and legs inward reflexively
activity_idea: Observe natural curling and stretching during calm alert periods.

skill: Brings hands together near chest
activity_idea: Observe baby’s hands coming together spontaneously during calm periods.

skill: Moves arms while following objects visually
activity_idea: Hold a toy and slowly move it in front of baby’s eyes, observe arm movements.

skill: Kicks legs rhythmically during alert or feeding times
activity_idea: Observe kicking reflex while baby lies on back or during diaper changes.

skill: Raises head slightly while moving arms
activity_idea: During tummy time, notice if baby lifts head while arms push gently against surface.

skill: Explores body movements freely

development_goal: Encourage early recognition of caregiver voice.

activity_idea: Speak softly to the baby from a short distance and notice eye or head movement.

skill: Shows quiet alertness to new sounds
activity_idea: Introduce gentle sounds like soft bells or rattle and observe baby’s alert posture.

skill: Begins to coo or make vowel-like sounds

development_goal: Develop response to pitch and tone.

skill: Pauses briefly when hearing familiar words

skill: Responds with coos when spoken to
activity_idea: Talk directly to the baby and see if cooing increases.

skill: Distinguishes between different caregiver voices

skill: Turns head or eyes toward sound source

skill: Feels comfort when held

skill: Recognizes caregiver’s face
activity_idea: Hold baby in front of your face and smile softly, observing their gaze.

skill: Calms when touched gently

skill: Smiles reflexively in response to caregiver
activity_idea: Talk or hum to the baby and notice if a reflexive smile appears.

skill: Relaxes when hearing familiar voices
activity_idea: Speak softly to baby using familiar tone and watch for calming behavior.

skill: Responds positively to gentle rocking

skill: Turns head toward caregiver
activity_idea: Call baby’s name softly and observe head or eye movement toward you.

skill: Shows startle or alert response to new stimuli
